respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castItem.roleDesc: an ambassador from Antony to Caesar
sister to Caesar and wife to Antony

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Alexandria. A room in Cleopatra's palace.

l.stage: Enter ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, her Ladies, the Train, with Eunuchs fanning her.
Exeunt Ant. and Cleo. with their train.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter CHARMIAN, IRAS, ALEXAS, and a Soothsayer.

l.stage: Enter ANTONY with a Messenger and Attendants.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, reading a letter, LEPIDUS, and their Train.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and MARDIAN.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter POMPEY, MENECRATES, and MENAS, in warlike manner.

l.stage: Flourish. Exeunt Caesar, Antony, and Lepidus.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter ANTONY, CAESAR, OCTAVIA between them, and Attendants.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS.

l.stage: She hales him up and down.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 6
div.stage: Flourish. Enter POMPEY and MENAS at one door, with drum and trumpet: at another, CAESAR, ANTONY, LEPIDUS, ENOBARBUS, MAECENAS, with Soldiers marching.

l.stage: Exeunt all but Menas and Enobarbus.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 7
div.stage: On board Pompey's galley, off Misenum.
Enter two or three Servants with a banquet.

sp.speaker: First Servant
sp.stage: Enter CAESAR, ANTONY, LEPIDUS, POMPEY, AGRIPPA, MAECENAS, ENOBARBUS, MENAS, with other captains.

sp.speaker: Enobarbus
sp.stage: Pointing to the Attendant who carries off Lepidus.

div.stage: Music plays. Enobarbus places them hand in hand.

l.stage: Exeunt all but Enobarbus and Menas.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter VENTIDIUS as it were in triumph, with SILIUS, and other Romans, Officers, and Soldiers; the dead body of PACORUS borne before him.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Rome. An ante-chamber in Caesar's house.
Enter AGRIPPA at one door, ENOBARBUS at another.

l.stage: Enter CAESAR, ANTONY, LEPIDUS, and OCTAVIA.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 4
div.stage: Athens. A room in Antony's house.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 8
div.stage: Enter CAESAR, and TAURUS, with his army, marching.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 10
div.stage: Another part of the plain. CANIDIUS marcheth with his land army one way over the stage; and TAURUS, the lieutenant of CAESAR, the other way. After their going in, is heard the noise of a sea-fight.

l.stage: Enter CLEOPATRA led by CHARMIAN and IRAS; EROS following.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 12
div.stage: Enter CAESAR, DOLABELLA, THIDIAS, with others.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 13
div.stage: Enter CLEOPATRA, ENOBARBUS, CHARMIAN, and IRAS.

l.stage: Enter ANTONY with EUPHRONIUS, the Ambassador.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter CAESAR, AGRIPPA, and MAECENAS, with his Army; CAESAR reading a letter.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, ENOBARBUS, CHARMIAN, IRAS, ALEXAS, with others.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter two Soldiers to their guard.

l.stage: They place themselves in every corner of the stage.
Music of the hautboys as under the stage.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 4
div.stage: The same. A room in the palace.
Enter ANTONY and CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, and others attending.

l.stage: Exeunt Antony, Eros, Captains, and Soldiers.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter ANTONY and EROS; a Soldier meeting them.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 6
div.stage: Enter CAESAR, AGRIPPA, with ENOBARBUS, and others.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 7
div.stage: Field of battle between the camps.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 8
div.stage: Under the walls of Alexandria. Alarum.
Enter ANTONY, in a march; SCARUS, with others.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 9
div.stage: Caesar's camp. Sentinels at their post.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 10
div.stage: Enter ANTONY and SCARUS, with their Army.

l.stage: Alarum afar off, as at a sea-fight.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 13
div.stage: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and MARDIAN.

l.stage: Enter four or five of the Guard of ANTONY.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 15
div.stage: Enter CLEOPATRA and her maids aloft, with CHARMIAN and IRAS.

l.stage: Enter, below, ANTONY, borne by the Guard.
They heave Antony aloft to Cleopatra.
Exeunt; those above bearing off Antony's body.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter CAESAR, AGRIPPA, DOLABELLA, MAECENAS, GALLUS, PROCULEIUS, and others, his council of war.

l.stage: Enter DERCETUS, with the sword of ANTONY.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: Alexandria. A room in the monument.

l.stage: Enter, to the gates of the monument, PROCULEIUS, GALLUS and Soldiers.
Here Proculeius and two of the Guard ascend the monument by a ladder placed against a window, and, having descended, come behind Cleopatra. Some of the Guard unbar and open the gates.

div.stage: Enter CAESAR, GALLUS, PROCULEIUS, MAECENAS, SELEUCUS, and others of his Train.

l.stage: Flourish. Exeunt Caesar and his train.
Re-enter Guardsman, with Clown bringing in a basket.

sp.speaker: Clown
sp.stage: Re-enter IRAS with a robe, crown, c.

l.stage: Kisses them. Iras falls and dies.
To an asp, which she applies to her breast.
Applying another asp to her arm.

div.stage: Re-enter CAESAR and all his train marching.
